alert.note: Alert for Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:52AM CDT until March 26 at 8:14AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 330 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1151 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported numerous road closures due to flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, with an additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of additional rainfall expected through the afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Kimberling City, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Reeds Spring, Seligman, Indian Point, Branson West, Shell Knob, Golden, Table Rock, Emerald Beach, Kirbyville, Eagle Rock, Blue Eye, Chain-O-Lakes, Arrow Point, Coney Island, Lampe, Cape Fair, Ridgedale, Ozark Beach, Powersite, Table Rock Lake, Lake Taneycomo, Bull Shoals Lake, Table Rock State Park, Shepherd of the Hills State Park and Roaring River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
